job.title: Video Product Data Scientist, Apple Media Products - Austin
job.description: <br><strong>Summary<br></strong> <br>At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. If you are an ambitious, high-energy individual who is not afraid of challenges, we’re looking for you. <br><br>Apple is seeking an expert Data Scientist to join a team passionate about Data Science &amp; Analytics for the media space. This role will primarily focus on the Video business, which includes subscription (Apple TV+, Apple TV Channels, third party services and Apple Fitness+) and transactional business (iTunes movies/tv shows).<br><br>This role will involve working with Internet-scale data across numerous product and customer touch points, undertaking in-depth quantitative analysis, building models and partnering with business stakeholders to drive product and strategy.<br><br>The team’s culture is centered around rapid iteration with open feedback and debate along the way. We encourage independent decision-making and taking calculated risks. AMP Data Science collaborates extensively with partners across product, design, engineering, content and business teams: our mission is to drive innovation at Apple through deep quantitive research of the App Store, Apple Music, Apple TV, and Apple Arcade amongst other services.<br><br> <br><strong>Key Qualifications<br></strong> <br>2+ years of experience in a Data Scientist or Data Analyst role, preferably for a digital media or digital subscription business<br><br>Strong proficiency with SQL-based languages. Experience with large scale analytics technologies such as Hadoop and Spark preferred<br><br>Curious product/business approach with an ability to condense sophisticated concepts and analysis into clear and concise takeaways that drive action.<br><br>Familiarity with Python/R, Git, and data visualization tools such as Tableau for full-stack data analysis, model building, insight synthesis and presentation. Knowledge of A/B test experimentation design preferred.<br><br>Excellent communication, social and presentation skills with meticulous attention to detail.<br><br>Strong time management skills with the ability to work with tight deadlines and pressure from executive requests.<br><br> <br><strong>Description<br></strong> <br>Dive deep into large-scale data to uncover trends and identify key insights that will advise business strategy.<br><br><br>Craft how best to monitor, measure and understand business performance and build out associated Keynote narratives, datasets, and dashboards.<br><br><br>Partner closely with the Product organization to help them make evidence-based decisions.<br><br><br>Collaborate with business, marketing, finance and executive teams to generate regular presentations for C-level.<br><br><br>Your creative problem solving skills will be utilized daily.<br><br> <br><strong>Education &amp; Experience<br></strong> <br>Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field. Ideally, Master’s or PhD in related field.<br><br> <br>Role Number: 200239723<br><br>
